column2: [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"|a letter]] to Deirdre Levinson''' (his former student
column3: who at this time was in [[Orange Free State|South Africa]]).

column1: *'''Publication:''' A description of the letter was included in ''[[Michael Silverman Catalogue 23]]'' and in ''Bonhams Books
column3: Maps and Manuscripts. 2004] & [http://www.tolkienbooks.net/php/details.php?reference=72495 Manuscripts and Autograph Letters. 2004] at [http://www.tolkienbooks.net/ TolkienBooks.net] (accessed 26 November 2011)</ref>

column1: *'''Description:''' Tolkien comments on conditions in South Africa
column2: and gives Levinson news of various appointments in [[Oxford]]
column3: including [[Nevill Coghill]] as the Merton Professor of English Literature
column4: and [[Elaine Griffiths]] as a Lecturer. Tolkien was shocked by the death of [[wikipedia:Roy Campbell (poet)|Roy Campbell]] but relieved by the general tone of his obituaries. He is sorry "''to be pinned down to beer
column5: especially in quantity. On the whole it goes down better with tobacco than other drinks; but I have never been a gargantuan swiller of it''".<ref>[[Wayne G. Hammond]] and [[Christina Scull]]
